column2: et benedīcat nōbīs; illūminet vultum suum super nōs
column4: ^ May God have mercy on us
column5: and bless us; may he cause the light of his countenance to shine upon us
column6: and may he have mercy on us

column1: 3 ^ ut cognōscāmus in terrā viam tuam
column2: in omnibus gentibus salūtāre tuum. ^ that we may know thy way upon earth
Deus; confiteantur tibi populī omnēs. ^ Let people confess to thee
column3: O God; let all people give praise to thee.
et gentēs in terrā dīrigis. ^ Let the nations be glad and rejoice
column4: for thou judgest the people with justice
column5: and directest the nations upon earth.

column2: Deus; confiteantur tibi populī omnēs. ^ Let the people
column4: confess to thee; let all the people give praise to thee.

column1: 7 ^ Terra dedit frūctum suum; benedīcat nōs Deus
column2: Deus noster. ^ The earth hath yielded her fruit; may God
et metuant eum omnēs fīnēs terrae. ^ May God bless us
column3: and all the ends of the earth fear him.
